meanings.definition: Dawd (noun): a foolish or stupid person
meanings.sent1: Tommy felt like a dawd when he forgot his lunch at home.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the dawd for not completing the homework.
meanings.sent3: The dawd in the story always made silly mistakes that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a dawd when she accidentally wore mismatched shoes to the party.
meanings.sent5: The character in the movie was portrayed as a dawd, always getting into funny situations.

meanings.definition: Dawd (verb): to waste time or be idle
meanings.sent1: Don't dawd around, finish your chores before it gets dark.
meanings.sent2: She tends to dawd when she has a lot of work to do.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to dawd in the sun, lazily stretching out on the warm pavement.
meanings.sent4: Time dawd away as they sat by the river, watching the water flow gently.
meanings.sent5: The old clock seemed to dawd, its hands moving slowly as if reluctant to show the passing time.
